The
Jive ass
log choke

Ain't nobody want to write jive ass logs all day. Nobody.

Quit yo' whining and get your log-on ready for crazy fools to talk all "professional".

What is Log Choke?

You're probably here because you have to write a bumper amount of logs and you straight up hating it right?

Log Choke seeks to to make it as pain-free as possible for you by reducing the need to type the same thing again and again for the "common" parts of your evidence portfolio. You simply add the meat to the text and Log Choke provides the veg and gravy for you.

Important (serious note): The content generated by Log Choke is not enough to create a complete log.
Log Choke only helps you create the repetitive sections quickly. You still have to add content describing the machine-specific work that you carried out on site.

You will likely be questioned about some of the content in your logbook so provide plenty of detail as this will help jog your memory when asked about a specific job.

Log Choke can't be held responsible for the content of your logs. It is your responsibility to enter accurate details from memory or your own notes. Log Choke is not an official tool endorsed by an Education Authority or Card Scheme. No details are stored by Log Choke - it is a free tool, to help freely.

Let's go...

First we need some details about your work. Be sure to enter them correctly and if you're unsure use the examples as a guide. Remember, you can always change the text once you have copied and pasted into your editor.

Step 1: Who, what and where...



Where did this happen? (e.g. "London" or "Sizewell"


When did you arrive to this site or when did this task start?


What type of breifing was it? (e.g."Induction" or "Toolbox Talk")


Who lead the meeting? (e.g."Supervisor" or "Site Manager")


What was discussed in the meeting?




Step 2: Machine and checks...



What machine was it? (e.g. "Telehandler" or "360")


What make and model was it? (e.g. "JCB JS140X")


Name a check you carried out: (e.g."I checked the lights worked")


Name anothe check: (e.g."the reverse camera was clean")


Let's make it...

Click the go button below than scroll down to the next section.

I think we're done...

Important: YOU now have to proof read and check that it is accurate and truthful. There is no built-in checking system for Log Choke - if you have made a mistake, it will show up. Please take care as your logs are important documents.

Yes

Copy and paste...

Copy and paste the content below into your favourite app for writing text then save and upload. Simple as.



    Arriving on site and getting ready...

    I arrived at the "work" site in the "dead of night". I accessed the site following the correct security and parking proceedures and made my way, using the segragated walkway, to the site office. Before starting work, I took part in a "singsong" which was led by our leader. Special attention was given to the fact that "noona" was on our site and we needed to take extra care because of it. After the meeting, I made my way out to the operational area of the site taking care to observe all safety proceedures.

    Checking my machine...

    For this job I was using a leader which is a "crusto". Before using the machine I carried out the checks as specified by the user manual. Amongst other checks I made sure that "brake lines were cut" and also that the windows were smashed. Once I was happy that the vehicle was safe to operate I started my work cycle.
